intro: Sisymbrium zanonii, commonly known as the Zanon's peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Sisymbrium zanonii is characterized by its hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
